dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so uh, we were looking at Forbes' highest-paid TV actresses list for last year, right? And the numbers are kinda wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so uh, we were looking at Forbes highest-paid T V actresses list for last year, right? And the numbers are kinda wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah! I love these lists. Who took the top spot, like, officially? My money’s always on someone from *Modern Family*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah! I love these lists. Who took the top spot, like, officially? My money's always on someone from Modern Family.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You'd be right! Sofia Vergara, no surprise there. But get this, she clocked in at a massive 42.5 million dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You'd be right! Sofia Vergara, no surprise there. But get this, she clocked in at a massive forty two point five million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World's Highest-Paid Actresses 2018 1. Sofia Vergara Earnings: $42.5 million Primary Show: Modern Family

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [gasps] Whoa, wait, 42.5? That's… that's insane! How much more is that than second place?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, wait, forty two point five? That's... that's insane! How much more is that than second place?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Um, well, Kaley Cuoco from *Big Bang Theory* was second at 24.5 million. So Sofia was like, 73% more! It’s not just her acting salary either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, well, Kaley Cuoco from Big Bang Theory was second at twenty four point five million. So Sofia was like, seventy three percent more! It's not just her acting salary either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her giant haul, which clocks in at 73% more than second-ranked Kaley Cuoco's $24.5 million, leads this year's ranking of the small screen's top earners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the endorsements. That’s where the real money is, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the endorsements. That's where the real money is, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Her manager, Luis Balaguer, he actually said in 2016 their "endorsement department is a well-oiled machine." Like, nearly half her payday comes from deals with SharkNinja Coffee, Rooms To Go…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Her manager, Luis Balaguer, he actually said in twenty sixteen their endorsement department is a well-oiled machine. Like, nearly half her payday comes from deals with SharkNinja Coffee, Rooms To Go...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our endorsement department is a well-oiled machine. By contrast, 95% of Cuoco's earnings can be attributed to her role on Big Bang Theory. Cuoco and her male co-stars took a pay cut, from an estimated $1 million an episode to $900,000 an episode, in an effort to free up cash for ranking newcomers Melissa Rauch (No. 6, $12 million) and Mayim Bialik (No. 6, $12 million). But she still makes plenty from the show, which is now in its final season. Grey's Anatomy's Ellen Pompeo ($23.5 million) ranks third. Playing Meredith Grey for 15 seasons on Shonda Rhimes' Grey's Anatomy has allowed her to negotiate for a hefty upfront fee, a cut of the backend and a producer fee on spinoff Station 19. When your face and your voice have been part of something that's generated $3 billion for one of the biggest corporations in the world, you start to feel like, 'OK, maybe I do deserve a piece of this,' Pompeo told The Hollywood Reporter in January. Rounding out the top five are Law & Order: SVU's Mariska Hargitay (No. 4, $13 million) and Modern Family's Julie Bowen (No. 5, $12.5 million). Both forgo endorsements and instead make their cash on screen. The Highest-Paid Oscar Nominee This year's Oscar nominees have all earned prestige, but some of them alrea... Together, the world's 10 highest-paid TV actresses earned a combined $168.5 million between June 1, 2017, and June 1, 2018, up from $156.5 million in the same period last year. Returning to the ranking is Homeland's Claire Danes (No. 9, $9 million), who last appeared on the list in 2014. Rauch and Bialik are the only newcomers this year. Cast renegotiations saw their pay boosted to an estimated $500,000 an episode for the soon-to-conclude show. Three actresses dropped off the ranking: Robin Wright, Mindy Kaling and Priyanka Chopra. Wright did not have any new House of Cardsepisodes in our scoring period while Kaling's The Mindy Projectconcluded. Fewer parts led to a smaller salary for Chopra, who clocked $10 million in 2017. Methodology All earnings estimates are from June 1, 2017, through June 1, 2018. Figures are pretax; fees for agents, managers and lawyers are not deducted. Earnings estimates are based on data from Nielsen, Box Office Mojo and IMDB, as well as interviews with industry insiders. The World's Highest-Paid Actresses 2018 1. Sofia Vergara Earnings: $42.5 million Primary Show: Modern Family 2. Kaley Cuoco $24.5 million Big Bang Theory 3. Ellen Pompeo $23.5 million Grey's Anatomy 4. Mariska Hargitay $13 million Law & Order: SVU 5. Julie Bowen $12.5 million Modern Family 6. (tie) Mayim Bialik $12 million Big Bang Theory 6. (tie) Melissa Rauch $12 million Big Bang Theory 8. Kerry Washington $11 million Scandal 9. Claire Danes $9 million Homeland 10. Pauley Perrette $8.5 million NCIS Forbes.com
